dfischer.utils

Class UserTransactionRuntimeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.UserTransactionRuntimeHandler

  • public class UserTransactionRuntimeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage user-defined transactions during the load test execution.
    Since:
    V5.4-F
    See Also:
    UserTransactionContext, PerformanceData.getUserTransactionMap()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserTransactionRuntimeHandler() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTransaction(UserTransactionContext userTransactionContext)
      Add a transaction to the handler.
      java.util.ArrayList<UserTransactionContext> getNotExecutedTransactions()
      Get all not executed transactions.
      java.util.ArrayList<UserTransactionContext> getPendingTransactions()
      Mark all pending (already started but not yet ended) transactions as failed, and get all pending and "ended but not yet measured" transactions.
      UserTransactionContext getTransaction(long transactionId)
      Get a (previously added) transaction from the handler.
      void resetTransaction(UserTransactionContext userTransactionContext)
      Reset a particular transaction in order that it can be re-used for measuring new values.
      void resetTransactions()
      Reset all transactions in order that they can be re-used for measuring new values.
      void setPendingTransactionsAsDefective()
      Mark all pending (already started but not yet ended) transactions as defective.

      • UserTransactionRuntimeHandler

        public UserTransactionRuntimeHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • addTransaction

        public void addTransaction(UserTransactionContext userTransactionContext)
        Add a transaction to the handler.
        Parameters:
        userTransactionContext - the transaction to add

      • getTransaction

        public UserTransactionContext getTransaction(long transactionId)
        Get a (previously added) transaction from the handler.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - the ID of the transaction to get
        Returns:
        the transaction, or null if no transaction with such an ID exists

      • resetTransactions

        public void resetTransactions()
        Reset all transactions in order that they can be re-used for measuring new values. Note that internally the transactions are cloned in order to get new instances. This because it's unclear when an URL thread ends when a timeout occurs - clone to avoid that data of transactions are overwritten.

      • resetTransaction

        public void resetTransaction(UserTransactionContext userTransactionContext)
        Reset a particular transaction in order that it can be re-used for measuring new values. Note that internally the transaction is cloned in order to get new instance. This because it's unclear when an URL thread ends when a timeout occurs - clone to avoid that data of transactions are overwritten.
        Since:
        V5.5-F

      • setPendingTransactionsAsDefective

        public void setPendingTransactionsAsDefective()
        Mark all pending (already started but not yet ended) transactions as defective. This method is called when a yellow error occurs during the load test execution
        See Also:
        UserTransactionContext.TRANSACTION_STEP_STARTED, UserTransactionContext.setDefective()

      • getPendingTransactions

        public java.util.ArrayList<UserTransactionContext> getPendingTransactions()
        Mark all pending (already started but not yet ended) transactions as failed, and get all pending and "ended but not yet measured" transactions. This method is called at the end of a loop.
        Returns:
        a list of all pending and "ended but not yet measured" transactions. All of these transactions will be added to the load test result by the caller of this method.
        See Also:
        UserTransactionContext.TRANSACTION_STEP_STARTED, UserTransactionContext.TRANSACTION_STEP_ENDED, UserTransactionContext.TRANSACTION_STEP_MEASURED, UserTransactionContext.setFailed()

      • getNotExecutedTransactions

        public java.util.ArrayList<UserTransactionContext> getNotExecutedTransactions()
        Get all not executed transactions. This method is called at the end of a loop.
        Returns:
        a list of all not executed transactions. All of these transactions will be added to the load test result by the caller of this method.
        See Also:
        UserTransactionContext.TRANSACTION_STEP_INITIAL
